Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with leaves and a stem to show what a healthy, growing plant looks like.
The student can draw and label the sun to show that plants need light to live and grow.
The student can draw water (e.g., raindrops or a watering can) to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can draw a plant that does not look healthy (e.g., wilted or droopy leaves) when it does not have light.
The student can draw a plant that does not look healthy (e.g., wilted or droopy leaves) when it does not have water.
